page.title: 09PROBLEMS CREATED BY THE A25
page.content: {Traffic}in Westcott is a big problem. Pedestrians can take 5 minutes to cross the main road. During a 30 minute study 1422 vehicles passed through Westcott, including 2 bicycles 18 motor bicycles, 8 coaches, 89 lorries and 1305 cars.{In a 30 mile {speed zone 67% of the cars were {exceeding the speed limit. {During a 90 minute period 6 cars {were overtaking in the no overtaking {zone in Westcott.}A minor{accident between two articulated lorries demonstrated the need for a wider road. People travel to Westcott to go shopping, 45% of these have trouble {parking}in Westcott. The narrow pavements along the main road are a threat to all pedestrians.
